so_44021118: writelogs() {
  exec 4>"${1}.json"
  flock -x 4
  tee -a "$1" | jq -sRf json_log_s2o.jq >&4
}
exec 3> >(writelogs "$logfilename")

exec 3>&-
flock -s "$logfilename.json" -c :

exec 3> >(tee -a "$logfilename" | jq -sRf json_log_s2o.jq >>"$logfilename.json"); log_pid=$!

so_67437273: # docker-entrypoint-custom.sh
#!/bin/sh
# do the modification
sed -i 's/exec "$@"//g' /docker-entrypoint.sh
# Just run it
/docker-entrypoint.sh "$@"

# Dockefile....
FROM postgres
RUN sed -i 's/exec "$@"//g' /docker-entrypoint.sh

  echo "Remote command exited with a successful exit status" >&2

Top-3 Scripts:
ul_196271: ssh -f user@host '<your command here>'

-f      Requests ssh to go to background just before command execution.
             This is useful if ssh is going to ask for passwords or
             passphrases, but the user wants it in the background.

so_24587007: while read line; do
    stdout=$(command $line)
    case $? in
        0) awk -v l="$line" -f horsepower <<< "$stdout" ;;
        # other cases, as needed
    esac
done
